Class dom.session.ViewListManager 

java.lang.Object
    |
    +----dom.session.ViewListManager
final class ViewListManager
extends java.lang.Object
Manager of all of lists associated with the View (group of Views, and DObjects). This includes the list of SessionViewIDs identifying the current group membership, and the list of DObjects in the group (which can be in one of several states depending upon whether the DObject has been constructed/activated/destroyed, etc.) Most methods on this class are synchronized...it is an implementation of the 'fully synchronized object' pattern described by Doug Lea in his book "Concurrent Programming in Java". The View has the only reference to this object, but it is declared final anyway to prevent any unexpected concurrency problems.

NOTE: NONE OF THIS CODE SHOULD CALL EXTERNAL CODE. THE CODE BELOW THAT DOES THIS (FOR NOTIFICATION) IS GUARANTEED NOT TO BLOCK OR BE SYNCHRONIZED ON ANY OTHER OBJECT. THEREFORE, THIS OBJECT WILL NOT RESULT IN DEADLOCK IFF ALL THE CODE BELOW AVOIDS CALLING EXTERNAL METHODS.

Author:
Scott Lewis
See Also:
View
Source Code:
ViewListManager.java

Method Detail

getGroupMembership

SessionViewID[] getGroupMembership()
Method to get at the group membership information for this View. Returns an array of Objects that contains SessionViewIDs of all view currently known to be in the group.
Returns:
SessionViewID[] that contains SessionViewIDs identifying all the Views currently known to be in the group.

addGroupMember

void addGroupMember(SessionViewID id)
Add a new view id to the set of known group members. Does this atomically, so that no other membership changes can occur while this change is being made.
Parameters:
id - the SessionViewID to add

removeGroupMember

void removeGroupMember(SessionViewID id)
Remove a view from the set of views known to be in this group. Calls destroyDObjectsFrom to remove any/all client presences of the objects associated with this SessionViewID.
Parameters:
id - the SessionViewID that is leaving the group.

getGroupSize

int getGroupSize()
Get current number of group members
Returns:
number of group members in group

addNewDObject

boolean addNewDObject(DObject object,
                      boolean activate)
Add new DObject to those known to this view. Does this atomically, so that view change cannot occur while this is happening.
Parameters:
object - the DObject to be added
activate - whether the DObject being added should be activated
Returns:
false if some problem...should not be a problem if data is valid.

addDObjectToLoading

void addDObjectToLoading(LoadingDObject object)
Add given LoadingDObject to myLoadingList. Does not add the object if the id associated with the object is already in myLoadingList.

removeDObjectFromLoading

void removeDObjectFromLoading(DObjectID id) throws DObjectNotFoundException
Remove the DObject with the given DObjectID from the loading list.
Parameters:
id - the DObjectID of the DObject to remove
Throws:
DObjectNotFoundException - if the DObject isn't found on the loading list

createDObject

void createDObject(DObjectID id,
                   DObject object) throws DObjectNotFoundException
Moves the given DObject object from the loading list to the inactive list. Assumes the given DObject is currently on the loading list, if it is not, then a DObjectNotFoundException is thrown.
Parameters:
id - the DObjectID of the DObject
object - the DObject in question
Throws:
DObjectNotFoundException - if DObject not on loading list

addDObjectToInActive

void addDObjectToInActive(DObjectID id,
                          DObject object,
                          LoadingDObject loadingDObject)
Add given DObject to the inactive list of objects. Also removes the LoadingDObject from the loading list. This method does the entire operation atomically.
Parameters:
id - the DObjectID of the object
object - the DObject of the object to add to the inactive list
loadingDObject - the LoadingDObject to remove from the loading list

void privateNotifyActivated(DObject object)

clear

void clear()

destroyDObjectsFrom

private void destroyDObjectsFrom(SessionViewID id,
                                 boolean match)
Destroy all DObjects whose home ID matches the one given (or not, determined by whether the match parameter is true or false). Must call only from synchronized methods in this class.
Parameters:
id - the SessionViewID identifying a particular view
match - if true, destroy all DObjects who think their home is id; if false, destroy all DObjects who think their home id is different than id

activate

void activate()
Activate all inactive DObjects.

deactivate

void deactivate()
Deactivate all active DObjects.

getDObjectIDs

java.util.Vector getDObjectIDs(SessionViewID id,
                     boolean match)
Get a Vector of DObjectIDs that either believe their home view id to be the same as the given SessionViewID, or not, based upon the value of the match parameter
Parameters:
id - the SessionViewID to compare to
match - if true, this method returns the Vector of DObjectIDs whose home view id is the same as id; if false, returns the Vector of DObjectIDs whose home view id is *not* the same as id

verifyDObject

boolean verifyDObject(DObject object)
Verify that given DObject is in one of our lists (other than the destroyed list). Makes sure parameter is not null, then checks to see that the object's id is found somewhere, and that the matching DObject is the same entity that was passed in.
Parameters:
object - the DObject to verify
Returns:
true if found somewhere in our lists, false otherwise

Parameters:
notify - the DOBjectNotification to remove

getDObjectFromAnywhere

DObject getDObjectFromAnywhere(DObjectID id)
Given provided id key, get the corresponding DObject. User might want to then call getAccessFacet to get a facet for sending messages to the DObject.
Parameters:
id - the DObjectID of the DObject we are looking for
Returns:
DObject found corresponding to DObjectID. Null if not found.
